inference:
Let $x=\angle CYX$.  Then $\angle BXY=3x-108$ and $\angle AXE=3x-108$.  Since $\overline{AB}\parallel \overline{CD}$, $\angle AXE+\angle BXY=180{}^\circ$, so $3x-108+3x-108=180$, $6x=396$, $x=66$, and $\boxed{\angle BXY=3x-108=84}$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{84}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Since $\overline{AB}\parallel\overline{CD}$, we have $\angle AXE = \angle CYX$.  Letting $x = \angle AXE$, we have $x = 3x - 108^\circ$.  Solving this equation gives $x = 54^\circ$.  We therefore have $\angle BXY = \angle AXE = \boxed{54^\circ}$.
